item.title: [Live session] Agentic developer workflows powered by Rovo Dev

item.title: How Next.js Got Its Snappy Client Navs Back
item.description: Frontend developer Sam Selikoff recently joined Vercel and questioned the Next.js team about achieving snappy client navigation with React Server Components (RSC). At the Next.js Conference, he highlighted the challenges of using RSCs while maintaining fast navigation, referencing past trends where frameworks moved rendering back to the server for improved performance. Selikoff discussed how companies like Twitter and Netflix have successfully enhanced load times and performance by…

Enhanced AI tools and open platforms are accelerating this process, leading to new opportunities in various fields. üåçüî¨ Stay tuned for more updates on how technology is shaping our future! #GoogleResearch #Innovation #AI…

item.title: Simplifying Distributed Systems: Jason Taylor Shows How .NET Aspire Makes the Complex Feel Effortless
item.description: üöÄ At JetBrains .NET Days Online 2025, Jason Taylor showcased how .NET Aspire simplifies building distributed systems. He emphasized that “effortless” means reducing friction while focusing on delivering user-centric features. With just a few clicks, developers can enhance ASP.NET Core apps with automatic resilience and health checks. The local development experience is notably improved, allowing new team members to onboard quickly with one press of F5. Discover more in the full presentation!…

item.title: Ken Thompson Recalls Unix‚Äôs Rowdy, Lock-Picking Origins
item.description: Ken Thompson reflects on the early days of the Unix operating system in a recent oral history at the Computer History Museum. üé§ At 82, he shares memories of the collaborative environment at Bell Labs, where innovation thrived among a spirited group of tech enthusiasts. üí° Thompson details his transition from the failed Multics project to the creation of Unix, emphasizing the importance of experimentation and community. He also shares a quirky anecdote about raising a baby alligator at the lab!…

item.title: Why PyTorch Won
item.description: During the PyTorch Conference 2025 in San Francisco, I had the opportunity to interview Luca Antiga, a key figure in the PyTorch Foundation. Antiga shared insights on why PyTorch has thrived in the AI landscape. Its user-friendly, “pythonic” nature has made it a favorite among researchers, who have since transitioned to the tech industry. Moreover, PyTorch has maintained relevance through various AI advancements, including generative AI. It‚Äôs now vital for both model training and production,…

item.title: One night changed everything: Why I sleep out for Covenant House

This approach aims to enhance customer discovery, ensuring shopping feels personalized and effortless. #DoorDash #Personalization…

item.title: How Block Got 12,000 Employees Using AI Agents in Two Months
item.description: üöÄ Block has successfully deployed AI agents to its 12,000 employees in just eight weeks, a feat shared at the All Things Open 2025 conference. The team pivoted to focus on user-friendly design, ensuring even non-technical staff could easily access the tools. #AI #Innovation #TechNews #EmployeeEngagement #Block

item.description: üåç As we celebrate 20 years of Cisco Crisis Response (CCR), we reflect on resilience from Hurricane Katrina to Hurricane Helene. item.title: Real-World IT Sustainability: 3 Case Studies From Green IO London

item.title: How AI Can Help IT Teams Find the Signals in Alert Noise
item.description: üö® IT teams face a challenge with alert fatigue as 95-98% of alerts are often noncritical. This overwhelming noise can lead to burnout and decreased productivity. Mandi Walls from PagerDuty emphasized the need for better frameworks using SLOs, automation, and machine learning to improve alert management. Effective solutions can reduce stress and enhance the work environment for developers. #AlertFatigue #DevOps #MachineLearning #ITManagement #Productivity

item.title: AI Week 2025: Recap
item.description: üåê AI Week 2025 has concluded, focusing on how to harness AI’s power while maintaining control. Key announcements included new products and partnerships aimed at enhancing AI security and usability. üîí The event emphasized four main areas: securing AI environments, protecting original content, supporting developers, and improving Cloudflare with AI features. Stay tuned for updates on our Blog, AI Avenue, and CloudflareTV! üìÖ #AIWeek2025 #Cloudflare #AISecurity #TechInnovation #AI

item.title: Conference Hopping: Training Attendee Scanning Def Con
item.description: üö® The Black Hat NOC faces unique challenges, as it operates in a cybersecurity hub where scanning and ethical hacking are expected. Cisco is enhancing security with network-based telemetry to monitor diverse personal devices at the conference. An alert recently identified suspicious activity linked to a training session targeting an external IP associated with Def Con. #Cybersecurity #BlackHat2025 #Cisco #ThreatDetection #EthicalHacking

item.title: Driving Cisco XDR Integration With Third-Party Partners at Black Hat
item.description: Cisco is the Official Security Cloud provider at Black Hat USA 2025, showcasing its latest advancements in XDR integration. These integrations enhance the Security Operations Center’s capabilities, allowing analysts to quickly investigate Indicators of Compromise (IOC) with a single search. Special thanks to alphaMountain.ai and Pulsedive for their contributions to the event. #Cisco #CyberSecurity #BlackHat2025 #XDR #MalwareAnalysis üöÄüîçüíª

item.title: Cisco Secure Firewall: SnortML at Black Hat USA 2025
item.description: Cisco is the Security Cloud Provider for Black Hat USA 2025! Attendees can participate in hands-on training sessions, using cloud resources for real-time attack simulations. The Cisco team ensures stable connectivity and monitors traffic to protect against unauthorized attacks. SnortML, Cisco’s machine learning tool, demonstrated high accuracy, detecting over 100 attacks with only 21 false positives. Stay informed about cybersecurity innovations! üîíüíª #Cisco #BlackHat2025 #Cybersecurity…

item.title: Black Hat Training Attendees Scan Aviation Organization
item.description: üöÄ The Black Hat conference highlights the unique challenges of cybersecurity, particularly within its Security and Network Operations Center (NOC). Attendees engage in ethical hacking, leading to expected scanning and exploitation activities. This dynamic environment differs from typical corporate settings where such actions are seen as malicious. With a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policy, comprehensive monitoring becomes challenging. The focus shifts to robust network-based telemetry for…

item.title: Black Hat USA 2025: 10 Years Protecting Black Hat
item.description: Cisco celebrates a decade as the Official Security Cloud Provider for Black Hat USA! üéâ Partnering with companies like Arista, Corelight, Lumen, and Palo Alto Networks, Cisco helps build and secure the Black Hat network. The NOC focuses on continuous network stability, delivering seamless security and visibility through an embedded SOC. üîíüåê #BlackHat2025 #CyberSecurity #Cisco #NetworkOperations #TechPartnerships

item.title: Refining SSO at Black Hat USA
item.description: üöÄ Exciting updates from Black Hat USA 2025! Cisco Duo has enhanced its role as the multifactor authentication (MFA) and single sign-on (SSO) provider for the Network Operations Center (NOC). The successful deployment of Duo Directory has expanded user access, supporting over 100 users at the event. This upgrade improves identity and access management for both users and admins. Key features include streamlined password management and a new Global Enrollment Policy to simplify onboarding. üîê…

item.title: Securing DNS With Umbrella at Black Hat
item.description: Cisco continues to enhance security at Black Hat, focusing on DNS monitoring since 2017. üåê With Umbrella, they route DNS traffic through a centralized service, gaining insights into potential threats like malware and phishing. At Black Hat USA 2025, encrypted DNS requests were blocked to improve visibility into user traffic. üîç The team prioritized monitoring the ApateWeb PUP delivery and phishing campaign, noting specific domain patterns. #Cisco #BlackHat2025 #CyberSecurity #DNS #Umbrella

item.title: Rebuilding homes and a resilient community in Western North Carolina
item.description: In Western North Carolina, Cisco Crisis Response and 40 Communities are aiding in the recovery from Hurricane Helene. üå™Ô∏è After the storm caused severe damage, affecting over 73,000 homes, a coalition was formed to support local leaders and nonprofits in the rebuilding efforts. üè† Nearly a year later, the focus remains on restoring homes, especially for low-income families, while ensuring vital services are accessible. ü§ù #CommunitySupport #HurricaneHelene #RebuildingTogether #CrisisResponse…

item.title: Marketing Velocity Reimagined Wins Triple Industry Recognition!

item.title: Meet Our Newest Innovators: Welcoming AI4SE Interns as JetBrains Employees!

Their work will soon lead to journal publications! üìö The AI4SE program, launched in 2023, combines academic research with industry…

item.title: ICPC World Finals Livestream: ecnerwala and SecondThread Speed-Solving Kotlin Challenge

Don’t miss the chance to see Kotlin’s strengths and get inspired to join the upcoming Kotlin Heroes contest! #ICPC #KotlinHeroes #CompetitiveProgramming #LiveEvent…

item.title: Hack Week 2025: How these engineers liquid-cooled a GPU server
item.description: üöÄ Hack Week 2025 at Dropbox focused on the theme ‚ÄúKeep It Simple,‚Äù encouraging innovation and collaboration. One highlight was the “Liquid Cooling CPU/GPU Hardware” project, which won the Learn Fast award. The team developed a custom liquid cooling system for GPU servers to address the thermal demands of AI workloads. This system demonstrated significant benefits, including lower operating temperatures and quieter performance. Future plans include expanding testing across multiple data…

She reflects on the connections she’s made, highlighting that cultural differences have not hindered her ability to…

item.title: Cloudflare Launching AI Miniseries for Developers (and Everyone Else They Know)
item.description: üöÄ Cloudflare has launched “AI Avenue,” a miniseries designed to demystify AI for developers and the general public. Each episode explores AI’s growth, capabilities, and human augmentation stories, making the technology approachable and engaging. Viewers can interact with AI hands-on, breaking down fears and showcasing its potential. Join the journey to learn more at aiavenue.show! #AI #Cloudflare #Innovation #Technology #HumanAugmentation

Ktor continues to evolve, offering support for modern scalable applications, including new features for dependency injection and server-driven UI development. For in-depth insights,…

item.title: Do any CISOs feel lucky?
item.description: Cybersecurity events like the RSA Conference and “Hacker Summer Camp” in Vegas are crucial for industry leaders. This year, CISOs expressed heightened concerns over nation-state threats and the impact of AI on security. Key discussions included resilience and anti-fragility in cybersecurity, with panels addressing AI‚Äôs role in enterprise threats. Informal settings also allowed for deeper conversations among CISOs about the practical use of AI and data protection challenges. #Cybersecurity…

item.title: The power of ten ‚Äî and the power of Purpose
item.description: üöÄ Cisco empowers employees through the Time2Give program, offering ten days off to volunteer and $10,000 in matching donations. In FY25, 81% of employees participated, contributing over 566,000 volunteer hours. This initiative not only supports communities but also enhances employee retention and recognition. Learn more about our impact and future goals for FY26! üåçü§ù #Cisco #CorporateResponsibility #Volunteerism #CommunityImpact #EmployeeEngagement

item.title: Supabase Launch Week 15 Hackathon Winner Announcement
